x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Every year, millions of dollars worth of donated medicines go unused or expire because they are not matched effectively to real-world needs at the community or clinic level.
Nonprofits and healthcare NGOs often receive surplus or non-requested medications, while patients lack access to essential drugs. This mismatch leads to waste, delays in care, and operational inefficiencies.
Many clinics don’t have the capacity to analyze patient trends or forecast medicine needs — especially in under-resourced or disaster-affected regions.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: MedMatch AI: AI Agent for Matching Donated Medicines to Patient Needs
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

MedMatch AI uses ServiceNow's new AI Agent to create a smart, conversational assistant for NGOs, clinics, and donor organizations. The AI Agent:

Understands incoming medicine donations (type, quantity, expiration, etc.)

Analyzes clinic-level data on patient demographics, diseases treated, and medicine usage trends

Uses AI to match donated inventory to projected demand at each facility

Provides recommendations on where and how to distribute donations for maximum impact

Suggests redistribution of excess or soon-to-expire stock between clinics

Offers dashboards and alerts for unmet needs or donation gaps

This makes the medicine donation process more targeted, efficient, and equitable.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Integration with third-party drug donation portals or inventory systems

Access to basic patient data, disease prevalence, and medicine consumption trends

AI model fine-tuning to adapt to local medical terminology and regional health patterns

Ability to import donation data via CSV/API from partners like WHO, Direct Relief, or Red Cross

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Data inconsistency between NGOs and clinics (formats, quality, frequency)

Ensuring data privacy and security of patient-related information

Limited digital infrastructure in some regions (requiring offline-first or SMS-based options)

Language localization to support AI Agent use in multiple countries or contexts

Ensuring trust and human oversight for AI-generated recommendations
